documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
Bakke claimed that Davis’s special admissions program violated the equal
protection clause of the U.S. Constitution, the California Constitution, and
Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which provides:
No person in the United States shall, on the ground of race, color, or national origin,
be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be subjected to
discrimination under any program or activity receiving Federal financial assistance.
The Supreme Court was thus asked to ru
